title: (x) Pentagone - Housebroken {Ignacio}
content:
First time I use that! :-)   
   
Any idea about the name of the typeface used on the second line PENTAGONE?   
   
 ![pentagone](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053250im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49687.gif)   
   
merci!
author: jfp

comments.content: Looks a lot like [Colonel](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053250/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gautier/colonel/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=PENTAGONE), but the stencil gaps aren't quite as wide.

Seems to be the stencil version of DIN, ' [DIN Schablonierschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053250/http:/kisd.de/~marian/dinschab/)', by [Marian Steinbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053250/http:/kisd.de/~marian/).. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053250im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
_Edit.: Well, too fast, I am sorry, 'DIN Schablonenschrift' doesnt seem to match, either.. Hmm.._
Thanks for theses answers, it helped to resolve the problem.
Probably too late but that one is [Housebroken](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053250/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=GENCOL-FO&sub=view).
